review.title: Using Ontology-Based Context in the Portuguese-English Translation of Homographs in Textual Dialogues
review.abstract: This paper introduces a novel approach to tackle the existing gap on message translations in dialogue systems. Currently, submitted messages to the dialogue systems are considered as isolated sentences. Thus, missing context information impede the disambiguation of homographs words in ambiguous sentences. Our approach solves this disambiguation problem by using concepts over existing ontologies.

sections.text: DOI: 10.5121 / ijaia.2015.6502 17This paper presents a novel approach to closing the existing gap in the translation of messages into dialog systems. Currently, messages transmitted to dialog systems are considered as isolated sentences. Therefore, a lack of contextual information impedes the ambiguity of homographic words in ambiguous sentences. Our approach solves this ambiguity problem by applying concepts beyond existing ontology.KEYWORDSMachine Translation, Semantic Web, Ontologies, Dialogue Systems

sections.text: This section provides a comprehensive overview of the development of this novel method, which aims to assist automatic translators in selecting a translation that is more suitable for homographic terms in dialog systems. Figure 1 provides a visual overview of the JUDGE methodology. The first step, semantic verification of homographic words, is responsible for selecting the meaning of ambiguous words. This step is divided into two activities: morphological analysis and; semantic analysis. The second step, translation, is responsible for the realization of the translation of the message to be sent through the dialog system.
